sub_title: Pedagog Professional, Sales & Service Associate, Storyteller, Former Project Development Officer, Social Worker & Community Volunteer
summary: An experienced program officer with strong skills in program management, a results-oriented, self-motivated social worker and social researcher in the fields of transnational migration and activism, post-war rehabilitation and reconciliation, religious education and peace building, disability and mental health, alcohol and drug demand reduction. Flexible and curious to learn new concepts and adapt to multidisciplinary environments. An enthusiastic team player with advanced interpersonal skills. A creative, engaging storyteller for young children.

Every book in the shelves are donated by international families living in Eindhoven, and to date, the library houses 3,000 books for the ages of 0-16 years. To instill the love for reading, The Reading Pier offers free weekly storytelling sessions in English for children. Every Wednesday, two storytellers will be at the library to read stories and do simple craft activities. The morning session (10:30 am) is read to children aged 0-4 years old and the afternoon session (2:00 pm) to children aged 4 years and older. For more information, follow The Reading Pier via Facebook. To donate books and other inquiries, please send an email to thereadingpier@gmail.com.

•Narrate, read and dramatize storybooks, and create craft activities.
•Discover the unique experiences and journeys of book-loving parents and children before and after finding The Reading Pier Club.
•Host book fairs biannually from popular children’s books publishers.
•Collaborate across departments to brainstorm, create, edit, and publish engaging content for both specific and general audiences.', 'title': 'Storyteller - Reading Pier Club', 'employment_type': 'Freelance'}]}, {'company': {'id': 1062241, 'name': 'Caritas Internationalis', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEiTdganZUHeg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519903922783?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=DBHJBkkJungXeV1YHOxlYS2ReZacmysrWMpJj6pT3Qg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/caritas-internationalis/', 'employees': {'start': 11, 'end': 50}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Colombo', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Caritas Internationalis', 'description': '• Drafted and obtained approval for funding for the project proposal: Promotion of Safe Migration of Women Domestic Migrant Workers in Sri Lanka from Catholic Relief Services (CRS) Asia.  
• Supported the programme manager to plan, organize, coordinate and successfully execute awareness programmes on safe migration for the project staff of 8 Caritas dioceses. 
• Monitored progress of projects in 8 Caritas dioceses, met with project stakeholders and assisted the monitoring team with administration of questionnaires, focus groups and interviews.                    
• Managed content updates in the database on national, regional and international organizations working on labour migration. 
• Translated (Sinhalese to English) and disseminated the hand book Planned programmes for dioceses designed by Caritas Sri Lanka.', 'title': 'Programme Officer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 28828, 'name': 'Leonard Cheshire Disability', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQGWlhqRSwERsg/company-logo_400_400/0/1523865030264?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=rznYva2S5yFhSgxb2TR4_mFblyNEmGM_2m-tRxQPQnE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/leonardcheshire/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sri Lanka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'Leonard Cheshire', 'description': '• Planned and conducted a community survey and a need assessment in 15 village officer divisions, and identified 150 persons with special needs and developed a database. 
• Formed a community network of 150 family caregivers, social services officers and volunteers, and achieved increased awareness on/and access to the government welfare services and non-governmental aid for persons with special needs.
 • Organized and coordinated a training and awareness programme on physiotherapy exercises and services in collaboration with Negombo base hospital for 65 persons with locomotor disabilities, their home caregivers, and volunteers, and established a monthly physiotherapy clinic at Wester Seaton Cheshire home for the disabled in Negombo. 
• Development of Health and Rehabilitation of the Persons with Locomotors Disability: 2010, A Community Project at Negombo district, Sri Lanka: Field Work Record, Unpublished.', 'title': 'Community Social Worker', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sri Lanka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'company': 'Alcohol and Drug Information Centre (ADIC)', 'description': '• Performed data collecting for Spot Surveys on Alcohol and Tobacco Demand Trends in 6 districts, and assisted the research team in data coding, entering, and analyzing.
• Performed proofreading and rewriting texts to improve clarity and readability of educational/promotional material on drug prevention. 
• Organized and participated in poster campaigns, and strengthened the organizations’ network of people by taking part in the discussions on drug prevention.  
• Held Responsibility for updating ADICs’ Research Bibliography on Alcohol, Tobacco & other drugs-related studies, and disseminating to libraries and social services organizations for references.', 'title': 'Copy Editor and Data Collector- Research and Information', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'National Institute of Mental Health', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sri Lanka', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}}, 'company': 'National Institute of Mental Health', 'description': "• Developed and implemented detailed pre-discharge plans for clients soon to be reintegrated into community. 
• Updated treatment plans monthly with latest intervention strategies and progress notes.

• Encouraged socialization and engagement through occupational therapy, music therapy and social activities.
